name: Urban Commuter Pro
tagline: Upgrade your daily ride with precision suspension and extra range.
description: A balanced commuter build focused on smoothing out cracked pavement and adding dependable range. Ideal for riders navigating the inner ring of Antananarivo.
highlights: Dual air fork + coil rear suspension tuned for potholes
Deck extension with integrated modular battery mount
Smart controller with regenerative braking profiles

parts.name: AeonFlex Adjustable Suspension Fork
parts.notes: Comes preloaded for 65-85 kg riders. Includes quick install spacers for most 10" hub scooters.

parts.name: VoltBridge 48V Smart Controller
parts.notes: Unlocks regenerative braking tuning and three-stage throttle response. Flash the commuter preset after install.

parts.name: UrbanDeck Modular Battery Kit
parts.notes: Adds 12 km of range with quick release shield. Includes waterproof cabling harness.

timeline.title: Strip down & inspection
timeline.details: Remove stem column, wheels, and deck plate. Photograph wiring layout for quick reassembly.

timeline.title: Suspension swap
timeline.details: Press in new head tube bearings and torque to 45 Nm. Align brake caliper before tightening the fork crown.

timeline.title: Controller + wiring
timeline.details: Mount smart controller, route sensor cables along stem channel, secure with heat-resistant wraps.

timeline.title: Battery + deck mods
timeline.details: Install modular deck plate, test battery quick release, and confirm connector polarity.

timeline.title: Road test & tuning
timeline.details: Calibrate regenerative braking on sloped street, retighten stem bolts, document final settings.

name: Weekend Trail Scrambler
tagline: Grip, torque, and lighting for dusty switchbacks just outside the city.
description: Designed for mixed dirt and cobblestone trails north of Analamanga. Reinforced components handle bumps while keeping the ride agile.
highlights: 11" knobby tires with reinforced rim kit
Torque-heavy dual hub motors with hill mode preset
Full perimeter lighting and visibility harness

parts.name: TerrainClaw 11" Tire & Rim Kit
parts.notes: Requires truing stand for rim alignment. Swap front and rear simultaneously for best results.

parts.name: DualDrive 52V Hub Motors
parts.notes: Flash hill mode profile before locking case. Add extra heat paste on stator for longer climbs.

parts.name: LumenArc 360 Lighting Harness
parts.notes: Includes brake-linked amber strips and under-deck glow. Route harness inside deck channel.

timeline.title: Wheel prep
timeline.details: Mount tires, balance using bead weights, and check for wobble under spin test.

timeline.title: Motor install
timeline.details: Swap axles, solder new phase wires, and update firmware with hill mode preset.

timeline.title: Deck reinforcement
timeline.details: Attach skid plate, install rubber dampers under deck, and seal edges against dust.

timeline.title: Lighting & harness routing
timeline.details: Secure harness with adhesive clips, test trigger brake lights, and set up running light animation.

timeline.title: Trail safety inspection
timeline.details: Torque check, brake bedding, and quick ride on mixed surface to verify traction.

name: Studio Showcase Mini
tagline: Compact build focused on aesthetics and modular accessories for meetups.
description: A lighter build intended for riders who want to stand out at community meetups. Quick to assemble with modular add-ons.
highlights: Powder-coated panels with interchangeable side guards
Quick swap handlebar system with 3 presets

parts.name: ColorShift Side Guard Kit
parts.notes: Includes 3 panel sets. Use included vinyl squeegee to remove air pockets.

parts.name: PulseDeck Audio Mount
parts.notes: Fits most mini Bluetooth speakers. Secure with vibration dampers before wiring.

parts.name: QuickBar Modular Stem
parts.notes: Choose between cafe, tracker, and upright presets. Requires torque wrench for stem cap.

timeline.title: Surface prep
timeline.details: Clean panels, remove old decals, and lightly sand for powder coat adhesion.

timeline.title: Panel swap
timeline.details: Install new side guards, secure with rivet nuts, and level the deck plates.

timeline.title: Deck accessories
timeline.details: Mount audio cradle, run power lead to accessory port, and test Bluetooth range.

timeline.title: Handlebar presets
timeline.details: Install QuickBar system, test each riding position, and torque to spec.

timeline.title: Showcase checklist
timeline.details: Polish finishes, verify lighting, and snap photos for community submission.
